utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know, I can't believe I'm getting my nails done! And you said it was gonna be fun! Which it kinda is. Also, you said there would be other guys here. There are no other guys here!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, there’s a guy right over there.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s a mailman! That’s our mailman! Hi. How are ya?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, don’t worry! This doesn’t make you any less of a guy! That does! What am I sitting on? I hate to think what this woman was scratching when this broke off.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you know who used to have nails like that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: OH…MY…GAWD!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey let me ask you a question. What does this light switch do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh, Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Didn’t it drive you crazy to have a switch and not know what it did?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know what it did! Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They wouldn’t have put it there if it didn’t do something! How can you not care?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Like this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, here’s another question for ya. Uhh, do you know what that silver knob on the toilet does?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure! It flushes it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, good. Now that since you know, when you come over would you mind actually using it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Ah!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Guess who we ran into today?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Janice?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Isn’t this amazing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How have you been?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh well, I’m divorced.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohhh, wow.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m riding the alimony pony.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And there it is.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I just came up to say, "Hi!" Hi! And you, sweetie, I’ll see you tonight.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: B-bye!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bye. I can’t stand the woman!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! I thought you were crazy about her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, but all of those little annoying things she did before we fell in love? Like her voice, her laugh, her personality—Well, they’re all back! Y’know? And she’s picked up like nine new ones!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So what are you doing bringing her here?! There’s people here!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it. I’m taking care of it tonight.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You are not. You have never been able to break up with her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I don’t have to break up with her this time. We’re not involved! I’m going to do a pre-emptive strike! I’m going to end it with her before it starts. My ass is like frozen!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, try sticking it in the freezer for 20 minutes. I’m tellin’ ya!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I can’t believe you really walk alone here! I mean, you hear such stories about New York.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, it’s really not that bad. I mean, I-I for one, feel perfectly safe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Help! Help!! Help! Help!!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No, no, no Ross! Ross, these are friends of mine from home. Liam, Devon, this is Ross.

utterance.speaker: Devon
utterance.content: Hey, mate.

utterance.speaker: Liam
utterance.content: How are ya man?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh hey, that was a good one, huh? Help! Help!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: So how are you? I’ve been meaning to ring you ever since I arrived but umm, well, I’ve been rather busy.

utterance.speaker: Devon
utterance.content: Do you realise that we have not seen each other since the night of that U2 concert?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh my God. I think you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Liam
utterance.content: Well, actually the last time you and I saw each other was that morning.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, Liam.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, Liam. So uh, what, were you guys playing soccer or something—or should I call it football?

utterance.speaker: Devon
utterance.content: We were playing rugby.

utterance.speaker: Liam
utterance.content: In fact we’re playing a game at the park tomorrow. You’re welcome to play too if you want.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ross play rugby? I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What’s ah, what’s so funny about that?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Well I mean, you’re American to start with. You don’t even have rugby here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, we didn’t have freedom here until 1776, either so…

utterance.speaker: Devon
utterance.content: So good then! We’ll see you at Riverside Park at 2:00! Cheers!

utterance.speaker: Liam
utterance.content: Cheers!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Cheers!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh boy, I just love to sing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, I-I know that you do, but I think one of the reasons people were complaining though, was that they paid to hear the actor sing Old Man River.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, look at us! Who would’ve thought that Cupid had a station at 14th Street Nails.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, we have to talk. I’m just getting out of a very serious relationship…

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I know! And I’m just getting out of a marriage, I mean talk about meant to be!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right! I just think that this is happening too soon.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, too soon, too schmoon. Face it honey, I am not letting you get away this time.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I hear ya. But! Unfortunately, my company is transferring me overseas!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh no! Where to? Too Paris?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! No! Not, Paris.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, could you just stop talking for a second? Yemen. That’s right, yes, I’m being transferred to Yemen!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t know exactly.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Ugh, well I will just have to soak up every once of Chandler Bing until that moment comes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But I do know that it’s some time tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Done?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yep!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This switch thing has been driving me crazy. So I turned it off and checked every outlet. Now, four of them don’t work. Which means, one of them has to be controlled by the switch. So, I plugged in things in all four of the outlets that-that make noise, so that way, when I turn it on I just follow the noise and find out which one it is.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I bet I stopped listening before you did.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know, you-you also could’ve used uh, lamps and then followed the light.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I’m using noise. Okay. All right! So, is everybody ready? Here we go. I hear something! I hear something! Where is it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s coming from Joey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God, that’s so freaky! Turn him off!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, hey, could we put on the news? I think it might be raining.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, just hold on a second. I’m watching this rugby thing on ESPN. I don’t know what the big deal is. I’m man enough to play this sport.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, you’re not even man enough to order the channel that carries the sport.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Hey there Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Janice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know uh, you didn’t really have to help me pack.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Ohh, well when you said all you were going to be doing between now and the time you leave is packing, you didn’t really leave me much choice. Did you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I-I thought I did but, I-I guess I did not!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I’m packing. Y’know I’m-I’m packing ‘cause I’m moving to Yemen tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks for telling me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m only going to pretend I’m moving to Yemen, it’s the only way I can get rid off her.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohhhh, good one! And Yemen that actually sounds like a real country.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Chandler! Come on, I’m gonna show how to roll up your underwear and stuff it in your shoes. It’s a real space saver.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, I do that ‘cause it makes me look taller.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Okay, Chandler, come on!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Joey, trade lives with me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope. Man look at this! Ross, I can’t believe you said you’d play rugby. I mean look how brutal this is!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, I can handle it! All right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Please, Ross, you-you got hurt playing badminton with my dad.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s ‘cause-‘cause you’re mom’s dog kept-kept looking at me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, Ross, look-look-look-look, look right here. That’s called a scrum, okay? It’s kinda like a huddle.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And is a hum, kinda like a scruddle?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross! They’re gonna kill you!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, why are you doing this anyway?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, you should’ve seen the guy that she used to go out with. I mean, he’s like Joe Rugby.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re kidding! And he plays rugby?! That’s so funny. Ohh! I see how you did that. All right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Anyway, she thought the very idea of me playing rugby with him was like hilarious. So I’m gonna show her how tough I really am!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. You’re right, you are a tough guy. You’re the toughest palaeontologist I know.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, come on look, Ross can take care of himself! It’s not like he’s…Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, don’t worry about me. Okay? I’ll just stay real energetic and stay away from the ball. I’ll uh, I’ll be that guy right out of the circle.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well maybe there was a dog lookin’ at him.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross-Ross-Ross-Ross! Stay away from that guy , and that guy . And that one—Dude! They’re all huge!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: They don’t look any bigger than me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, maybe that’s because you’re closer to you. So you look bigger to you from where you are.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I’m just going to say hi to the lads. All right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Whoa! I kinda liked it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I know what I have to do. I’ve got to go Red Ross. Y’know, Red Ross!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I totally don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on! The time we were all waiting in line for Dances With Wolves and that one guy cut in line in front of us and I just lost it?! Screamed at him! Turned all red! Red Ross!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’ll see.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Liam, do me a favour. Tell the lads to go easy on Ross, it’s his first time.

utterance.speaker: Liam
utterance.content: You don’t say!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Good luck, babe.

utterance.speaker: Liam
utterance.content: Ross! Ross! Come on! Get in here! Ross! Come on!

utterance.speaker: Liam
utterance.content: Ross, come on! Get in the bloody scrum! Ross, get in!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: JOEY!!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You…are…not going to believe it! Joshua came into work today, and guess what happened?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He asked you out?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. But I was showing him some cufflinks and I felt his pulse.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Saucy!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What are these?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Electrical plans for the building.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, okay, okay should I be scared?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know that switch does something, okay? So-so I went down to city hall and got these. All I had to do was pay $25 and wait in line for three hours.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! If only more people knew.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know you, really didn’t have to take me to the airport.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh please. Every moment is precious. Y’know? Besides, somebody had to ride in that other taxi with the rest of your luggage, and your friends don’t really seem to care too much that you’re leaving.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, we’re really not that close. Okay, so I guess this is uh, good-bye then.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: On no! No! It’s not good-bye, I’m not leaving until you get on that plane.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Then I guess it’s just, wait here then. Hi. I need one fake ticket to Yemen.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
utterance.content: One ticket to Yemen?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no, no. No, no, no, I just, I just need a pretend ticket.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
utterance.content: I’m sorry sir, I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What would you give to a kid if he wanted a ticket to play with?

utterance.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
utterance.content: Are you travelling with a child?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. All right, y’know what, she’s gonna think that I’m handing you a credit card, but what I’m really gonna do is hand you a library card.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
utterance.content: Ah, sir a ticket to Yemen is $2,100 and we don’t take library cards.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: What’s the matter? Is something wrong? Do you have to stay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: American Express?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I can’t believe they’re doing that to him! I told them to go easy on him!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No offence but, y’know sometimes it’s hard to understand you, y’know with the accent, so…

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: That’s just halftime, there’s more of this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Did you see me? I was pretty good, huh? That is one fun game!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, could you do me a favour? Could you just grab me a bottle of water?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks. I-I think I’m dying. I really do.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, poor baby.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Tell my son that I love him. Excellent! Well, okay, I gotta have some more fun!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ross, they are killing you out there!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s not true!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She’s right! You have to stop!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? No! No, I’m not stopping. I’m Red Ross!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, if you go back out there, you’re gonna be Dead Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t care! I am not quitting! I insist on finishing this game!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: All right, all right, if you insist on doing this, at least let me help you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, God no! That is no place for a woman. Those guys will grab anything.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No. That’s not what I’m saying. I just may know a few things that might help you inflict some pain.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I like that.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Yeah? Listen closely, Devon has got a weak ankle.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: One swift kick and he’ll back off.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, bad ankle, got it!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: And that big bloke with the beard, he has got a trick hip. Yeah. And uh, and David over there, I heard he doesn’t wear a cup.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah? I can use that, trick hip, no cup, okay! Okay!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: And uh, Liam, Liam’s got bad knees. You hit him right and he’ll go down like a lamp.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But-but, Liam’s on my team.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I don’t care! You just get him!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m gonna go get him! Okay, I am going back in!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The Red Ross! Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What-what are-what are these?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, just some pictures I made and hung up. I thought they’d brighten up the place. They do don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No-no-no, no!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know that there’s no hole there, I just really liked that picture.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Look at this!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, but there is a wire back there! I mean that switch is connected to something!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t care! The wires have come loose in your head!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I just thought that if I could follow the wire I could find out what it did.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And did you?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No. It disappears back there behind that baseboard. For a minute there, I thought it went downstairs.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But it didn’t. Say hello to Mrs. Chatracus.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Chatracus
utterance.content: Hello darling.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello, Mrs. Chatracus.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Now, are you sure you don’t want to go see a doctor?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh no! That-that’ll just bring me down! This was great! I mean I-I-I was great! This is a great day! Y’know what? I’m buying everyone coffee. All right? If someone would just grab my wallet, it’s in my pocket.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, not you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uhh, look, your eye’s still popping out a little, I’m gonna go get some ice.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, ice! I am so in the mood for ice!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You were amazing out there.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I kinda was, wasn’t I?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I made a man twice my size cry. I mean, I haven’t done that since I was four and I washed my dad’s Porsche with rocks.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You really enjoyed yourself didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Please! Are you kidding? I-I hurt three huge men, I gave a guy a bloody nose—I mean I-I’m not proud of it but, I really am. And it’s all because of you, wonderful, amazing you.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I think you’ve got concussion.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no, I’m serious. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You’re welcome. I’m sorry. Did I hurt you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s worth the pain. Y’know what, you know what? It’s not.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
utterance.content: This is the final boarding call for Flight 664 to Yemen.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I-I guess I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, my Bing-a-ling. I’ll wait for you. Do you even know how long you’re going to be gone?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, just until we find an energy source to replace fuel.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I’ll right you everyday. 15 Yemen Road, Yemen.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, good-bye. Good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Janice! There you are! There you are! I had to have one last kiss, and also-also you said that you were going to leave right after I got on the plane!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: No! No! I wanna see you take-off.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I then guess I’m going to Yemen! I’m going to Yemen! When we get to Yemen, can I stay with you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right. The super couldn’t figure out what it did. A $200 an hour electrician couldn’t figure out what it did. I’ve had seven pretty serious shocks. I officially give up.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I guess Joey was right, it does nothing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: See? I’m doing it. I am totally doing it. I lost it.
